result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tanisha L. Reyes

defendant.name: Reyes, Tanisha L.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
10:38 a.m. Defendant Tanisha L. Reyes in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Tanisha L. Reyes in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf159 (status), 16cm120 (status), 16cf92 (sentencing), 15cm238 (sentencing on revocation), 15cm78 (sentencing on revocation). 
In 16cf159 - State moves to dismiss but read-in Counts 2, 3 and 4 - Granted. Schiek statement that victim rights have been complied - victims in court. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.
State moves to dismiss but read-in 16cm120 - Granted. Court notes that no Information has been filed in 16cf92 and parties proceeded to enter into DEJ.  Court will hold off on proceeding in 16cf92 - Count 3. Off record discussion held. Recess 11:02 a.m. 11:09 a.m. - State files Information in 16cf92 - defendant previously pled to Count 3 on May 27, 2016 - Court reviews waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that defendant is confirming plea entered on May 27, 2016. Schiek/Bennett/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
15cm238
Jail - 12 months with Huber for all purposes
Jail credit - 151 days

15cm78
Jail - 90 days
Jail credit - 121 days (Time served)

16cf92- Count 3
WHS/POP - 4 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
AODA assessment and follow-through
Jail credit - 46 days if revoked
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.

16cf159
WHS/POP - 4 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Domestic Abuse Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
AODA assessment and follow-through
Jail credit 84 days if revoked
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.

Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given. NADVI given.
All financial obligations in 15cm238 and 15cm78 are reduced to civil judgment.
Adj. 11:33 a.m.
Status conference on August 30, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on August 25, 2016 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Tanisha L. Reyes
Current: 209 E. Park Street, Lower #4, Rhinelander, WI 54501 United States  (Effective: 05-27-2016)
Prior: 514 Lynne Street Upper, Rhinelander, WI 54501

2:05 p.m. Defendant Tanisha L. Reyes in court, in custody, with attorney Brian F. Bennett. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16CM120, 16CF92, 15CF169. Schiek speaks to agreement/resolution. No agreement in 16CM120, jury trial requested. In 16CF92 State moves to dismiss Cts. 1 and 4; deferred entry to Ct. 3. Court grants motion to dismiss. Defendant pleads no contest to Cts. 2 & 3. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of Cts. 2. Court defers entry of judgment on Ct. 3. Schiek/Bennett statement to sentencing on 16CF92 & 15CF169. Bennett files defendant's sentencing letter to the court. Court statement. $1,500 cash bond reduced to $1,500 signature bond. Review on DEJ scheduled for 5/17/17 at 3:30 p.m. 16CM120 scheduled for jury on 8/5/16 at 8:30 a.m. 

Court sentence - 16CF92/Ct. 2
Court Costs/DNA surcharge
DNA sample
Appeal Rights

Court sentence 15CF169/Ct. 3
60 days' county jail
55 days' credit/time served
Costs to civil judgment
Appeal Rights

9:10 a.m. Also calling 16CF92. Defendant Tanisha L. Reyes in court, in custody, with attorney Brian F. Bennett. Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Schiek states Information same as Criminal Complaint/to be filed within 24 hrs. Bennett proceeds--defendant pleads not guilty to all counts. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

2:48 p.m. Defendant Tanisha L. Reyes in court via video with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Tanisha L. Reyes in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf92 and 16cm120.  In receipt of both complaints, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing in 16cf92- - Bennett motion to modify bond. Bennett/Schiek statement on bond. 
Court denies motion to modify bond. 
Bail continued. Adj. 2:53 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 09:00 am.

3:03 p.m. Defendant Tanisha L. Reyes in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has not obtained an attorney. Bail continued. Adj. 3:04 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

1:34 p.m. Defendant Tanisha L. Reyes in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond. Adj. 1:36 pm.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
